title: Computer freezes playing LoL
body:
>  The application-specific permission settings do not grant Local Activation permission for the COM Server application with CLSID 
{6B3B8D23-FA8D-40B9-8DBD-B950333E2C52}
 and APPID 
{4839DDB7-58C2-48F5-8283-E1D1807D0D7D}
 to the user NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE SID (S-1-5-19) from address LocalHost (Using LRPC) running in the application container Unavailable SID (Unavailable). This security permission can be modified using the Component Services administrative tool.\

Found this error in my event log on Windows 10. Every time it crashes, that gets logged. Also a warning that says 

> The speed of processor 2 in group 0 is being limited by system firmware. The processor has been in this reduced performance state for 71 seconds since the last report.

replies.body:
If this freeze happens after you've loaded into a match, it's probably caused by the Game DVR feature being enabled by the recent Windows 10 Anniversary update. I suggest [disabling the Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) that the DVR feature resides in to see if it resolves the freezing.

Let me know if this helped.
